title: Samsung To Focus On Production In India And Vietnam As It Shuts Its China Factory Due To Costs

Samsung To Focus On Production In India And Vietnam As It Shuts Its China Factory Due To Costs

Samsung To Focus On Production In India And Vietnam As It Shuts Its China Factory Due To Costs

Samsung has pulled the plug on its manufacturing plants in China due to rising labour costs and poor performance against Chinese competition. It plans to focus more on manufacturing in India and Vietnam.

Reuters

This shutdown came right after the South Korean giant cut production at the plant in the southern city of Huizhou in June this year after facing a tough competition with Chinese competitors. It has lost a considerable market share from Chinese brands like Huawei, Oppo, Xiaomi etc.

In the Q2 2019 data, Huawei was the largest selling vendor in China with Samsung not even making it to the top ten, having just one percent of share in the market.

Samsung said in a statement to Reuters, "The production equipment will be re-allocated to other global manufacturing sites, depending on our global production strategy based on market needs,"

Samsung has also not mentioned how many employees were working at the facility at the time of shutting down. Samsung, however, did reveal the fact that the factory was established in the year 1992.

As of 2017, it had over 6000 workers, producing 63-million units. As per Samsung's annual report, it manufactured 394 million handsets around the world last year.

Samsung isn't the only global brand ceasing its manufacturing facility in China. Sony too has decided to terminate its manufacturing plants in China, with more focus on manufacturing in Thailand.

Reuters

A report by Nikkei Asia reveals that Samsung has shifted production to Vietnam due to cheaper labour costs. It has hired over 200,000 people to manufacture smartphones. The report also revealed that around 292 million handsets are being shipped from Vietnam alone.

Samsung has been manufacturing devices in India for two decades. In July this year, Samsung unveiled the world's largest manufacturing facility in Noida, Uttar Pradesh that is capable of producing 120-million phones in a year. Samsung also has a manufacturing facility in Tamil Nadu
